result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Richard Deja

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Richard Deja not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Brandon Richard Deja.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of  Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense requested a projected plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon Richard Deja in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Brandon Richard Deja in custody at MSDF.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Richard Deja appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of the defendan'ts 3 prior OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: Franklin PD Officer A. German. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Richard Deja not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Findling is in trial; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Richard Deja in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Brandon Richard Deja in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Brandon Richard Deja in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Richard Deja appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
